entry.title: Ethereum Name Service Registrations Spike 216% in One Week
entry.summary: Secondary sales on OpenSea meanwhile exceeded $7.9 million over the same period.

entry.title: Still No Plan for US Central Bank Digital Currency After Latest Fed Meeting
entry.summary: Panelists did not see an urgent need to press ahead with a CBDC.

entry.title: Much Ado About 'Nothing'? Why Polygon Is Making a Web3 Push Into Mobile
entry.summary: The upcoming Nothing Phone (1) will integrate Polygon’s tech for easier mobile access to dapps, games, payments, and more.

entry.title: Who’s Firing—And Still Hiring—During the Bitcoin Bear Market
entry.summary: Some crypto companies are feeling the crunch of a market crash and reducing their employee headcount to cope—but others are still expanding and securing fresh talent. Here's who's hiring and firing in crypto right now.

entry.title: Bank of England Wants Stricter Rules for Crypto to Avoid 'Systemic Risk'
entry.summary: The U.K.’s central bank renews its concerns about stablecoins—and wants stricter laws and regulation of the crypto market as a whole.

entry.title: 'Bitcoin Senator' Lummis Says Her Crypto Bill Leaves Most SEC Oversight Intact
entry.summary: Sen. Cynthia Lummis joined Decrypt's gm podcast to talk about how her crypto regulatory framework would divvy up oversight between the CFTC and SEC.

entry.title: Indian Crypto Taxes Crush Trade Volumes as Local Exchanges Eye Exodus
entry.summary: Exchange volumes in India have plummeted by at least 50% after the implementation of a 1% tax on all cryptocurrency transactions.

entry.title: Lido Token Jumps 24% as Staked Ethereum Slowly Repegs
entry.summary: Lido’s Staked Ethereum was at the center of controversy last month. Now, it’s stabilizing, prompting a swift rise in its native token.

entry.title: Nexo Eyes Acquisition of Troubled Crypto Lender Vauld
entry.summary: Cryptocurrency lender Nexo has announced plans to acquire 100% of rival platform Vauld just days after the latter halted client withdrawals.

entry.title: Singapore's Finance Regulator Mulls 'Limits on Retail Participation' in Crypto
entry.summary: Amid a string of recent bearish events in the crypto space, Singapore's financial watchdog is considering new safeguards to protect consumers.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Jump as Crypto Market Stages Mini Rally
entry.summary: Leading cryptocurrencies in Bitcoin and Ethereum have posted significant gains after the July 4th festivities.

entry.title: Price of Bitcoin Exchange KuCoin's KCS Token Tanks Amid Insolvency Rumors
entry.summary: Since rumors spread on Twitter about the exchange halting withdrawals, traders have sold off the company’s KCS token.

entry.title: Why Ethereum Scaler Arbitrum Hit Pause on Odyssey NFT Campaign
entry.summary: Arbitrum had to hit pause on its NFT-powered incentives campaign after fees on the layer-2 solution topped even those on the Ethereum mainnet.

entry.title: Chinese Tech Giants Alibaba, Tencent to Require ID Checks for NFT Purchases
entry.summary: China’s largest tech firms have adopted a new “self-discipline initiative” that aims to bring more clarity to the NFT space.

entry.title: Circle CEO Says USDC Stablecoin Provider Is in 'Strongest Position' Ever
entry.summary: Circle, the company behind the USDC stablecoin, is in its strongest financial position ever, according to CEO Jeremy Allaire.

entry.title: Crypto Lending Platform Vauld Halts Operations Citing Financial Difficulties
entry.summary: The Singapore-based crypto platform announced that it would halt operations and pause withdrawals until further notice.

entry.title: Bored Ape Yacht Club’s Creators Declared War on a Vocal Critic. Could it Backfire?
entry.summary: “Yuga has to win on two sides here,” one attorney said. “They have to convince a courtroom, but they also have to convince the public.“

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Bitcoin Whales Buy the Dip, Nic Carter Defends an Investment, SBF Memed as Atlas
entry.summary: Also: CEO Michael Sonnenshein said Grayscale is suing the SEC over the company’s Bitcoin spot ETF application.

entry.title: Laminate This: What to Say to Crypto Haters
entry.summary: Tired of clueless pundits and friends dredging up the same old talking points about why crypto is all a scam? Pull out this document.

entry.title: Web3 Leads to Cybersquatting 2.0: Here's What Brands Can Do
entry.summary: Although the extensions are .eth or .nft instead of .com, the fight over territory and trademarks remains the same.

entry.title: How to Launch a DAO
entry.summary: Here's a beginner's guide to the tools and apps you need to start a Decentralized Autonomous Organization.

entry.title: In Wake of Layoffs and Pulled Job Offers, Coinbase Announces European Expansion Plan
entry.summary: CEO Brian Armstrong was among the company executives meeting with policymakers in London and Dublin this week.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin and Ethereum Erase Gains, 3AC Files for Bankruptcy
entry.summary: Outflows from Bitcoin-specific funds hit a record-high dollar amount.

entry.title: BlockbusterDAO Hits R3WIND: What’s Next After Failing to Buy Nostalgia Brand
entry.summary: With the video store IP apparently not for sale (at least to a DAO), the collective hopes to move past the meme and keep building.

entry.title: Three Arrows Capital Files For Bankruptcy: Report
entry.summary: The bear market has mauled yet another high-flying crypto firm.

entry.title: Coinbase NFT Releases New Features as It Struggles to Attract Traders
entry.summary: Coinbase continues to build out its eight-week-old NFT marketplace touting an engagement-first approach.

entry.title: Voyager Digital Halts Trading and Withdrawals After Three Arrows Capital Default
entry.summary: Citing “current market conditions,” the embattled crypto trading platform has paused all customer activity.

entry.title: After Losing $60 Million in Bitcoin, El Salvador’s President Buys More
entry.summary: Nayib Bukele has spent another $1 million in Bitcoin, adding 80 BTC to El Salvador’s existing stash of 2,301 BTC.

entry.title: BlockFi, FTX Agree to New Credit Deal and Acquisition Terms
entry.summary: The FTX and BlockFi deal is nearing a close.

entry.title: Sorare Ethereum Soccer NFTs Surge After Signing PSG’s Kylian Mbappé
entry.summary: Sales of Sorare NFTs are up 795% over the past 24 hours after adding the French star as an investor and ambassador.

entry.title: Coinbase Denies Selling Customer Data to US Federal Agencies
entry.summary: The company said on Twitter that its software “does not make use of Coinbase user data. Ever.”

entry.title: As Bitcoin Crashes, Data Shows Whales Are Buying the Dip
entry.summary: Amid the ongoing crypto crash, on-chain data indicates that so-called Bitcoin whales have been quietly filling their bags.

entry.title: Supreme Court’s Restrictions on EPA Oversight Could Impact Bitcoin Mining
entry.summary: The Court’s ruling will have ramifications on the EPA’s ability to regulate energy plants as an industry and could prompt states to do more.

entry.title: VanEck Files Fresh Spot Bitcoin ETF Application
entry.summary: Days after Grayscale’s Bitcoin ETF application was rejected, investment Firm VanEck has filed a new application with the SEC.

entry.title: Toronto-based Crypto Lender Floats Funding, Equity Support to BlockFi: Report
entry.summary: Ledn has reportedly offered BlockFi additional financial support in the way of $450 million in a mix of funding and equity.

entry.title: Bitcoin Just Posted Its Second-Worst Quarterly Performance Since Inception
entry.summary: It’s been a brutal three months for Bitcoin investors as the leading cryptocurrency lost more than 56% in value in Q2 2022.

entry.title: CFTC Cites $1.7 Billion MLM in Its 'Largest Fraud Scheme Case Involving Bitcoin'
entry.summary: The agency alleges Cornelius Steynberg used a multilevel marketing scheme to bring in over 29.4K Bitcoin.

entry.title: DOJ Files Charges Against Baller Ape Club ‘Rug Pull’
entry.summary: The DOJ also announced three other crypto fraud cases amounting to over $100 million in potential losses.

entry.title: Facebook Begins Testing Ethereum and Polygon NFTs on Profiles
entry.summary: If deployed widely, users will be able to connect their cryptocurrency wallets to their Facebook profiles.

entry.title: BlockFi CEO Denies FTX Is Set to Acquire Crypto Lender for Only $25M
entry.summary: If a deal goes through, it won't be the first time FTX started an acquisition with a line of credit.

entry.title: Lolli Bitcoin Shopping App CEO at NFT NYC: NFTs 'Captured the Zeitgeist'
entry.summary: Alex Adelman, CEO of Bitcoin shopping rewards app Lolli, talked to Decrypt's Andrew Hayward at NFT NYC about why NFTs have impressed him and why he's "kind of sad" because Bitcoin "should have captured" the cultural moment that Ethereum and NFTs did.

entry.title: NFT NYC: How Dequency Is Using Blockchain to Decentralize Music Usage Rights
entry.summary: Just ahead of a live event during NFT NYC from BeetsDAO and Decrypt, Margaret Link and Keatly Haldeman of Dequency talk to Decrypt EIC Dan Roberts about how their company is using the Algorand blockchain to de-bug the decades-old process of music synchronization rights.

entry.title: The Bill Murray 1,000 NFT Project Reveal Trailer
entry.summary: A first look at actor Bill Murray's upcoming Ethereum NFT project with The Chive and Project Venkman.

entry.title: gm: Meet 'Move to Earn' NFT App Stepn
entry.summary: Stepn is the talk of Crypto Twitter: an app that rewards you in crypto for exercising outdoors. But first you have to buy a pricey sneaker NFT. Stepn CMO Shiti Manghani joined the gm podcast to talk about how the app works, its GST and GMT tokens, Stepn's recent decision regarding China, and why the future for NFTs is utility.

entry.title: NFTs and Knife-Throwing Abound at Superchief Gallery in LA
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin talks to Superchief Gallery co-founder Edward Ed Zipco about NFTs and the potential for digital art at Superchief's 10 anniversary showing in Los Angeles.

entry.title: #DecryptLive: Luxury Fashion Brands Are Going Crypto
entry.summary: From Dolce & Gabbana to Balmain, big names in fashion are embracing crypto and NFTs. Decrypt's Stephen Graves, Dan Roberts, Sander Lutz and contributor Alys Keys discuss the trend.

entry.title: Collateralized Monkey JPEGs: CEO of Arcade Talks to Decrypt at Consensus
entry.summary: Arcade, an NFT liquidity provider, says it's facilitating $25 million in loans against blue-chip NFTs like Bored Apes. Arcade CEO Gabe Frank talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Consensus 2022.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: What is a Dapp?
entry.summary: A dapp is a decentralized app built on blockchains to give you more ownership and freedom in your digital life. Dapps are the next generation of software. Explore the vast selection of dapps on Ethereum today. Curious how to build dapps? Start building free at infura.io.

entry.title: Bringing 'Snow Crash' to Life: Neal Stephenson Talks to Decrypt at Consensus
entry.summary: Neal Stephenson, who coined the term "metaverse" in his seminal novel "Snow Crash," speaks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson along with Bitcoin Foundation founder Peter Vessenes, about the new "free metaverse" they're co-launching, Lamina1.

entry.title: Edge CEO Paul Puey Talks 'Confidential' Bitcoin Mastercard Launch
entry.summary: Paul Puey, CEO of Edge Wallet, spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson about Edge's announcement of a new "confidential" crypto Mastercard. After Edge announced the card on Wednesday, Mastercard blasted crypto media to say it has nothing to do with the product—despite Puey telling Decrypt, "MasterCard is involved in entire process. They fully approved this, it’s fully legal and approved by MasterCard. It fits entirely within their framework.”

entry.title: gm: Christine Brown Left Robinhood to Go Full NFT
entry.summary: Christine Brown left her perch as Robinhood Crypto COO at the end of March to launch a new crypto venture. Now she has announced her new gig: Co-founder and COO at Floor, a token-gated NFT portfolio app that has raised an $8 million seed round. She talked to Decrypt's Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts about the company's plans, her own crypto and NFT bags, and her outlook on NFTs and on Robinhood.

entry.title: NBA's Spencer Dinwiddie Talks $26M Raise for Social Crypto App Calaxy
entry.summary: Spencer Dinwiddie's creator token platform Calaxy has raised another $26 million in funding. Dinwiddie tells Decrypt's Stacy Elliott what makes Calaxy stand out and why it can succeed.
